item.title: A Journey of a Thousand Miles begins with a Single step.
item.description:
qsort []     = []
qsort (s:xs) = qsort [x|x <- xs,x < s] ++ [s] ++ qsort[x|x <-xs, x >= s]

I’ll admit that I’ve never really understood the QuickSort algorithm until yesterday. I’m amazed by the clarity and simplicity of the algorithm once all of the surrounding cruft is stripped away.

item.title: "A Journey of a Thousand Miles begins with a Single step." by Nick Guerrera
item.description: The natural recursive definition of quicksort is beautiful and simple. On the journey to discovering the full ingenuity of the algorithm, I can't imagine anywhere else to start. However, I wouldn't classify good pivot selection or sorting in place as "cruft". After all, they put the "quick" in quicksort...
